text: Gustav Vigeland (11 April 1869 â€“ 12 March 1943) was an Norwegian sculptor. He is known for his sculpture in Frogner Park. He designed the Nobel Peace Prize medal. == Early life == Adolf Gustav Thorsen was born in Halse og Harkmark, which used to be a municipality in Mandal, Norway. == References == Category:Sculptors Category:1869 births Category:1943 deaths Category:Norwegian people
title: Gustav Vigeland
